Reviews.Title: “Nice, except for horrible beds”
Reviews.Author: WVtourist53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice except that the beds are among the worst I've ever had. Everything else about my four night stay was so nice I hate to give the hotel such a low rating, but really, beds are critical! Another reviewer mentioned that the beds are too soft - no, I disagree. The beds are not soft, they SAG. Two nights of this bed gave me my first ever back pain. Mine was apparently not the first complaint since there is a helpful list of back exercises included with the hotel information packet. I rearranged the room enough to pull one of the mattresses off the worse-than-useless box springs, put it on the floor and slept quite well after that. Other than that, the place is bright, cheerful, clean and friendly. The rooms are large for a city-center, the bathrooms are sensibly arranged and have all the necessities, and the breakfasts were wonderful. There are few restuarants within easy walking distance, but it's so close to a main subway line that this isn't much of a drawback. It would be a really good value if you didn't have to sleep there! Bottom line, I would not stay here again unless the beds were replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Helpful Staff, Value For Money.”
Reviews.Author: Dufflepod
Reviews.Content: Really can't say much more than the previous reviewers. 2 minute walk to the U-bahn. Clean room,Clean Bathroom. Free Internet access in the Lobby. The Staff really were friendly and helpful. The Breakfast at 9 Euros is a bargain. So many choices of hot/ cold options.You can also pick up a travel kettle/cups/coffee/tea etc all conveniently in a large plastic container ( near to the lifts) and make a hot drink in your room. I would very happily return here and have no hesitation recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: reggae_b0y
Reviews.Content: The location was great to get around to Berlin. The hotel was 2min walk from the nearest metro station and you could go anywhere from there. The room was very warm and the bathroom very clean. We didn't eat breakfast but it seemed to be great. There were 3 or 4 PC's with internet connection you could use for free. Staff was very kind and helpfull. This hotel is highly reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Petisco
Reviews.Content: The location was great and people were helpful and kind. They gave me a very tinny and small room, so I asked to change it and the 2nd and 3rd night I stayed in a better room and bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location to get around”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Spittelmarkt U-bahn station which is on the U2 line - one of the main lines which stops at Alexanderplatz, Potsdamerplatz etc...pretty much anywhere you need to get so it is very easy to get around whilst being situated on a nice quiet back street. Rooms weren't the biggest but very clean and modern. The beds were 2 singles pushed together but we didn't have any issues, they were very comfortable and we slept really well every night, the climate control was good, never needed to use the heat function though as the temperature was always on the warm side. Staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke good English. There is internet in the rooms but no WiFi, but there is WiFi in the reception - good for checking e-mails or planning your day ahead on your smartphone or laptop. There is a kettle, coffee and tea available from reception for free, they also sell bottles of water but you pay for the convenience (about €3 each) better to just pop around the block to the Lidl or Lotto shop and stock up on some supplies on the cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mg47
Reviews.Content: Booked via easy jet , nice quiet clean hotel a few hundred yards from Spittelmarkt U Bahn station with fast links across town to all the main sights. Friendly staff and excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trippin123134
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights in Best Western am Spittelmarkt. Booked via booking.com mostly because of the price and good location. It s only 300 meters from U-Bahn station Spittelmartk- so when u are interested in sightseeing and shopping in the center it s definitely a good trip base :) The hotel itself consists of two buildings next to each other. We stayed in the building beside the main one and had no problem att all with it. Reception staff nice and friendly speaking almost any language you want ;) Rooms nice, very clean and cozy with everything what and average traveller needs. Internet connetion (free) via cable in rooms wasn t working properly bt there is also wifi in the lobby. In general we liked BWH am Spittelmarkt a lot. Highly recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “Where to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: adnanmordeniz
Reviews.Content: I you want to stay in a nice place in Berlin . I can highly recommend this hotel. This hotel is close to the major centers both by walking, taxi or only 2 minutes walk from the Spittelmarkt U-bahn stop. The staff is great and the breakfast is best in the Berlin city. It is a quiet to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneMcDowell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2012. The location is excellent, only 2 minutes walk from the Spittelmarkt U-bahn stop and convenient for the tourist attractions such as Checkpoint Charlie and the Alexanderplatz. It is only a train ride away from the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag. In fact we could probably have walked to these but as the weather was so cold in January we used the U-bahn a bit more. The main attraction of this hotel is the breakfast! It is 9 Euros per person but well worth it. There is wide selection of breads, cheeses, meats and pickles, as well as cereals, yoghurts and hot options such as the delicious scrambled eggs with ham. The hotel is very modern and clean and the rooms provide everything you need. My only very minor issue was with the beds and pillows. The beds are quite soft and I found them a bit uncomfortable as a result. You only get one large soft pillow which I found very uncomfortable and ended up with a sore neck. The pillow was so soft it was like lying on a bag of washing! Overall though, If you want a clean, modern hotel in good central location then this is the place - the breakfast is an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Central Berlin (mitte), clean, modern, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ARKTIKMANN
Reviews.Content: Great super central location in Berlin Mitte. Rooms are modern but a little small, but, with a wardrobe, safe, desk with chair, night tables, lamps, larger windows that open fully, bathroom is all tile, with a shower, toilet sink and large mirror, and heating rake to keep the towels nice and warm after your shower. Staff is helpful and cleaning staff is good. Breakfast is great and full of alot of variety, for only 9 euros you cant beat that for a hotel. The area is nice and clean and there is a bakery, coffee bar and tapas restaurant right across the street. Around the block is a Lidl market for food, drinks, and everything else. Tobacco shop and Asian shop located on the same street as well. If you are in a hurry you can jump on the convenient U-bahn (U2). in a couple stops (4 mins) you are at Alexanderplatz. I really like the hotel and location. Walking - 12-14 min walk to Alexanderplatz. Checkpoint Charlie 15-17 min walk. Jewish museum 15 min walk. I would stay here again if returning to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and service”
Reviews.Author: mackeminafrica
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at this hotel in February and would highly recommend it. Central location just two minutes from Spittelmarkt U-bahn station and within walking distance of many of the major sites including Check Point Charlie.The hotel was warm, spotlessly clean, quiet at night and very comfortable.Rooms had modern clean bathrooms with shower, heated towel rail, hairdrier and soap/shampoo and there was airconditioning and opening windows if needed. You could pick up a box in the lobby with tea and coffee making requirements for use in the room and tvs in room were flat screen although only one English language channel. Free internet access in the lobby with four pcs available and a printer, plus free coffee. Front desk staff were friendly, efficient and knowledgeable.Two bakeries just across the street were also very handy for breakfast. Got this hotel at an excellent price with discount for three night stay. Would definitely use it again for future visits to Berlin. . .,

Reviews.Title: “Great option in central Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: Phosphora
Reviews.Content: I moved to this hotel after spending two miserable nights at a lousy hotel/hostel and I couldn't have been more pleased! The hotel is bright, clean, perfectly situated and a real bargain! Pros: the room was really clean and quiet. The shower was excellent, with good water pressure. The location is great- close to the U-Bahn and within walking distance of many of the major sights. Free wifi in the lobby and free use of computers. Cons: the bed was a bit hard, but not terrible. My biggest complaint is that the wifi is limited to the lobby area. The lobby has a few places to sit, but it's not some place you could settle into and get some work done or make a private call over skype. It's very utilitarian and can get a bit loud. Overall, this place is definitely a good value. If you don't want to pay for the breakfast option, there are two cafe/bakeries on the same block.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SpacedmanGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Staying in Berlin for only three days, we wanted a hotel just for sleeping in, as the rest of the trip was spent sightseeing. This hotel turned out to be perfect for our needs. The room (although quite small) was warm, clean, and had everything we needed. The staff all spoke English, were pleasant, and were very helpful with any requests we had. They also provided us with a city map on arrival. The free wired LAN internet in the room also made it very easy to plan our days. There are complimentary coffee and tea making facilities which you can pick up from reception and take to your room. The hotel's location is in a quieter area in the east of Berlin, but is just round the corner from Spittelmarkt underground station, which made it really easy to get to all the other areas we wanted to visit. We didn't eat in the hotel, so can't comment on the breakfast, but there's a fantastic bakery right opposite the hotel, which sells great pastries and sandwiches, and is open from very early in the morning. All in all, a great place to stay if you're planning to spend most of your time exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location...but nothing to eat.”
Reviews.Author: chutaiko
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to most of Berlin's historical attractions (Checkpoint Charlie, DDR Museum, Cathedral....etc.). The rooms are new, well furnished and the Internet is Free. Downside is that there is no food aside from breakfast. If you're hungry when checking in then go across the street to the Spanish Tapas place.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: N_Muralidharan
Reviews.Content: Location : In Berlin, there is so much to explore. And to help you with that, this hotel is very well located! It's a 3 or 4 minute walk to the Spittlemarkt U Bahnhof. From here you can catch connections to several parts of Berlin, including Alexander Platz (which has a S Bahnhof connecting you to so many more places.) If you're a walking kinda person, you'd love the walk to Mueseuminsel. Rooms : Clean, comfortable and the bathroom is quite neat too. Staff and Service: The staff at the hotel are very helpful, no complaints there. Food : Only breakfast - at an additional cost of 9 euros per person per night's stay. The spread is excellent. There is no option to have lunch or dinner here. However the folks at the reception will help you out with some flyers of places you can order from if you don't want to step out. (there are some nice options). There are a couple of cafes opposite the hotel too. They have boxes with a kettle, instant coffee packets and tea bags at the reception, so you can ask them for one of these before you head up to your room. Light Snacks and some beverages are available at the reception and are chargeable. Overall Rating - A good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jeffjan11
Reviews.Content: In walking distance of checkpoint charlie , topography of terror and berlin wall, all approx. (15 mins) ,museum island (10 mins),Potsdamer Plaza (25mins),Brandenburg Gates (30mins).U2 Spittlemarkt station is a couple of mins. walk from hotel,buffet breakfast 9 euro"s in hotel or a couple of options right facing hotel entrance,for restaurants the Nikolai quarter is a 10 minute walk or 2 stops on U2 line heading in the Pankow direction.There is obviously more illustrious hotels in Berlin but overall taking the location and cost of rooms into considaration this hotel is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - can't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: ando243
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son for 4 nights in early January. Here's a summary of what we found: 1/ Check in easy - very friendly and helpfull staff . I left my jacket behind and they sent it to Munich for me! Complimentary computers x3 in reception area. Bar tacked onto end of reception- good selection of drinks and snacks . 2/ Room- we booked a twin. Good size , very clean, comfortable beds. Appliances were all modern, aircon and satelite TV channels ( 1-2 in english). Bathroom spotless again with modern appliances.No wifi in room only cable- able to get wifi from 3rd floor room by holding phone out the window- worked ok. Rooms cleaned each day. 3/ Breakfast- great buffet style spread for 9 euro. Hot / cold foods, fruit, cerials, desserts, bread/rolls etc. Big seating area with several "rooms" branching off for some privacy. No restaurant at night but a great spanish restaurant across the road and a german one about 3-4 mins walk away. 4/ Transport- U2 Spittlemarkt station only 3-4 mins walk away. Safe area, no problems.Easy to get around even by walking.Cab ride to airport was around 23 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: TheRestlessSpirit
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Spittelmarkt is well placed to all the major landmarks in Berlin or within a short stroll to public transport links. The rooms, and the hotel in general, are very clean although the only downside is that there is no WiFi facility. That said, the internet is very fast and connected via an ethernet link. Tea/coffee and kettle are available for free in the lobby and can be taken up to your room for the duration. Breakfast was excellent and catered for all tastes. Should I visit Berlin again, I will make a point of returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Laurenlee
Reviews.Content: I made a booking at this hotel based on the 2,800 and something reviews he got on Booking.com. In the eyes of its customers, the hotel seemed to have nicely ticked all the boxes so I thought it was worth a try. Contrary to what someone wrote, the location worked very well in respect of those attractions that are situated near Mitte (and there are quite few from the main Museums to landmarks like Alexanderplatz). Our objective was to walk wherever possible in order to get a closer view of buildings+streets and we fully succeeded. Our room (I booked a 'family room') was comfortable and spacious with the wonderful eco-friendly/energy-savings tricks that Germans are famous for. At night it was very silent, which worked out perfectly. Our bathroom was great with both a shower and a bathtub. Both the room and bathroom were spotless clean. The staff at reception were polite and helpful and the buffet was simply superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Poppyontour_76
Reviews.Content: Positives Near to all tourist locations Near to U Bahn Amazing all you can eat breakfast for 9 Euro Excellent value for money Clean hotel Small bar area for a night cap (con...not great for long drink) Staff spoke English and where really helpful You could request a tea and coffee tray and also comp coffee in receptipon Really nice tapas resturant across the road if you arrive late like we did and excellant little bakers that sells coffee and amazing breakfast buns. Negative Only a breakfast bar No fridge in room Single beds, no double beds Beds very soft looking forward to sleeping on my rock hard bed tonight. All in all I would recommend this hotel to travels who want to do site seeing not great for romantic break. Top tip for visiting Berlin if you wish to visit the Riechstad you need to book, on previous vitsits you didn't need to also my most recent copy of loney planet didn't mention it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good option in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ggabi
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this place, but everything is just the way it should be! Friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricTGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights last week.My room was small but very comfortable and clean.It had a large TV and tea and coffee making facilities.The staff were very friendly and helpful.If you are staying at this hotel you hardly need to use the transport system as it is within walking distance of so many of the main places of interest.There is a subway station,Spittelmarkt,nearbye if required.If you are coming from the airport by train to Alexanderplaz you can use your 3 euro ABC ticket from Alexanderplaz S station to Spittelmarkt and the hotel is only round the corner.I will definately use this hotel again on my next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monkfish82
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Berlin for a surprise anniversary trip for my wife and stayed in this lovely, clean hotel. Staff were friendly and spoke brilliant English (as my German is rather ropey!!). We never used the restaurant but the small bar had everything you could want (including some rather delicious German beers) and there were also tea and coffee making facilities available to take to your room. Location was great and is near to the U-Bahn station so you are literally 5 minutes from Alexanderplatz and Potsdamer Platz which were bustling with shops, christmas markets and ....erm.... Beer Halls!! The only flaw I found with the rooms was the fact that it had two twin beds pushed together rather than a double and as a man of six feet and four inches i was sometimes a centimetre or two away from a tumble onto the floor!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jane104
Reviews.Content: Great in every way....good position, very close to Spittelmarkt subway. Very clean and tidy rooms, good bathroom with excellent shower. Wifi in the lobby, only improvement would be wifi in the rooms. Breakfast for 9 euros was great value and everything to choose from. Very helpful staff. Would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough and very clean”
Reviews.Author: geenius
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel but I have to say it it in the middle of a "building site". Make sure your windows are closed before 7am as the noise of the contractors and their machinery is not good. Very clean rooms but tiny, no frills. Your room will not be comfortable enough to spend much time in, other than being asleep. There is one upright rigid chair and a very, very low bed. The one major thing that this hotel needs is a decent bar to come "home" to after a days sightseeing. The seats mostly do not have a back to them you feel as though you are not encouraged to spend any time there. Thank goodness to the fabulous Irish Times Bar turn right out of the hotel, then left cross the round and a short walk away you will stumble upon it on Leipziger Straße . http://www.oscar-wilde-irish-pub.de/it_index.html. We were made so welcome, the food is really good pub food with very good portion sizes. Back to the Best Western, we never ever felt that we could find a comfortable seat, in your room or even at breakfast, which I have to say is quite good. So many fruit juices, meats, cheeses, etc. One big worry for us was that nobody "policed it". We felt that anyone could walk in off the streets and eat there, we were never once (5 nights) asked for our room number. Luggage could be left there safely for a refundable 1 euro, but it does fill up very quickly. I would suggest going down and reserving your "box" the night before. The reception staff were really helpful. Free internet access in the reception. To sum this hotel up is: don't expect anything other than a bed to sleep in, in a clean room - which is all you could ask for as we don't want to see Berlin from a hotel bedroom. Be aware of the noisy works outside at the time. Don't expect to have a nice bar to unwind in after a full days sightseeing. You really must visit the restaurant in the TV Tower, not expensive but totally unmissable. Remember to book your table online before your visit. You will then get fast tracked VIP service up to the top. Unfortunately you are not a VIP on the way down but the queue does move quickly and organised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Berlin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKWorker
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - subway just around the corner, so access to Berlin attractions easily available. Good clean room with TV. They advertise free in room WiFi, but when I was there it was not working in my room and staff could not fix it :( - hence only 4 out of 5 star rating Fantastic breakfast - at a reasonable price of 9 Euros Bike hire available from hotel. Quite neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: AndyMan99
Reviews.Content: We were spending 2 days in Berlin in May, 2011. Picked this hotel because of revues. The hotel is relatively new in a quiet neighborhood. Staff was very helpful on how to get the most of our time in Berlin - they were quite passionate about helping us enjoy our stay. Subway was around corner and the major bus line down the street. Breakfast was over the top even for a big breakfast person. Great area to start from.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: 12345London
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Clean, new and quiet Nice cafe directly across the road for breakfast- we didn't eat in the hotel (€9 for breakfast). Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KLREVIEW
Reviews.Content: I was booking this trip as a present for my huband & wanted it to be perfect & wasnt dissapointed. booking - excellent hotel & staff - excellent location - excellent would definatley stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great value, central location”
Reviews.Author: ar_curran
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, clean, comfortable well run hotel and we had a fantastic three nights here at the start of October. The buffet breakfast is excellent value at 9 euros per head - hot and cold drinks, cereal, breads, fruit, cheese and meats, eggs, pastries etc - which really set us up for the day. However, there is a coffee shot/bakery just across the road and a Lidl supermarket just 5 mins walk away. There was also a Tapas restaurant, and a few decent bars within 5-10 mins walk. The staff were friendly and welcoming and there was free internet access available in the lobby area. The location was great and right next to the underground station which was on the U2 line, going right through central Berlin, although it was within easy walking distance of Checkpoint Charlie, Museum Island and about 30 - 40 mins leisurely walk to the Brandenburg Gate. I would not hesitate to go back to this hotel or recommend it to others, it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel excellent Room and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tigertraveller65
Reviews.Content: Only 7pm frm Airport, 3 person room was large but Oh single beds so narrow, one roll over and you are on the floor. Third bed is in seperst Alcove in Rm 316 but new construction next door made noise unbearable from 7am all day. They shifted us to 301 on opposite side and room was huge, great Barhroom with bath and Sep shower but still 3 small beds and No Fridge.-

Reviews.Title: “City Break in Berlin - Sept 2011”
Reviews.Author: Steve-and-Andie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fairly new and mordern in style, situated near to U-bahn Spittlemarkt on U2 line - approx 200m. Central for all 'East Berlin' attractions. Very quiet area as no passing traffic. The hotel does have a small bar, but there is a small Tapas bar/restaurant opposite - good value for money. The hotel consists of two main buildings within hotel linked by a corridor. Breakfast rooms on lower ground floor, serving between 7 - 11 am. Excellent choice of food from bacon, scrambled eggs and sausage through to continental breakfasts. Room good size and very clean with large flat screen TV and air-conditioning. All rooms en suite with shower. Bed a little too firm for our liking. Note if you require tea and coffee making facilities in the room, these are available from reception on request. As we weren't flying until later on on our last day, the hotel has facilities for you to leave your luggage. Overall would recommend this Best Western hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: luci l
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very friendly and helpfull staff, the room is clean and with good size. I can not forget the delicious breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Very standard city hotel”
Reviews.Author: RockerLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: It's exactly what you'd expect. Clean and comfortable , no frills. A place to sleep but definitely not to spend any time in. The staff get a mixed review ; On the first night they insisted they had no double rooms in the hotel, and forced us into a twin room. The next day, after complaining again, they miraculously found a whole floor of double rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: roudi48
Reviews.Content: A hotel that combines the quality and reasonable prices! The rooms are completely clean and comfortable. The breakfast was tasty and had a variety of food for breakfast. Near at hotel there is a metro station and this helped us a lot to our transportations. The place that is the hotel is quiet and you feel safe! We enjoyed our staying a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Daria19
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean small rooms, rather basic. I booked a non smoking room - unfortunately there was cigarettes' smell inside my room.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: bpickard
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel and out of the way. Staff not very friendly and not much in the neighborhood. Most of all, after a long day touring the city, when you get back to the hotel there is no place to relax except in your small room. No real lobby. They do have 4 computers for guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Pallav1973
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel through the best western website and were inintially sceptical. however, upon reaching there, not only did we find that the hotel is amazingly friendly but also very close to the U-bahn station (metro station is about less than 100 metres away). the hotel is also very close to the City centre (Alexanderplatz). once connected on the U-Bahn, it was so convinient. We had high speed wifi and that resolved our connection with the rest of the world. For such high value for money, this hotel made me a fan of the best western hotel group.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good position”
Reviews.Author: Rik_Milano
Reviews.Content: It's the classical Best Western: good compromise between comfort, price and position in the city. The rooms are quite small, but at the same time quite comfortable and clean. Position is good, really close to Spittelmarkt underground: 4 stops and you are in Alexanderplatz. The two lifts close to the reception are definitely not OK: if the hotel is full you risk to wait really for a long time (up to 5-10 minutes). Just eventually take the one on the opposite site walking throw the breakfast area at underground floor. Parking is costing €15 /day and there around it's not easy to find an alternative. Beds are not the best you can find (too soft)

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly and a very small room”
Reviews.Author: Egill_travels
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night with my family. It is in walking distance of Friedrichstrasse, and the subway. Which is very good. It all seems very new and exotic, although our room was very small, and the view from the window was over a construction site, so not exactly exciting. The pillows were the same German giant pillows that I hate, but I knew that before going. Beds were comfortable and the room and bathroom were clean and nice. We only stayed there over night so the view(or lack there of) didn't bother us so much. Parking place was pretty expensive, but at least they had it, somewhere in the back with staff parking. Not vey easy to find and park. Staff was friendly and helpful. Lobby was not so exciting, but did its job.

Reviews.Title: “Small clean room but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Elival
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night, we moved to another hotel (Art'otel) for the rest of our stay, and very happy with our decision. The room was clean but quite small. The safety box did not work, no fridge in the room and extremely noisy during the morning. If we knew there was a construction site right outside our windows we would have requested another room, I wish the hotel would have advised us that there was going to be so noisy to either change hotel or even pay a bit more for another room. Unfortunately overall the experience was not a good one. I would say there were only 2 positives, the room was clean and walking distance (5min) to the U.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with perfect location to explore Berlin Centre”
Reviews.Author: KochRa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a rather modern one with all service you need for a weekend trip. I got a room bright and clean, new furnitured and a big bathroom with daylight. Wireless Internet was available in the room for free. The breakfast is ok for this class of hotel. Ok the surrounding is not that spectacular, it looks like a modern business quarter under construction, but with the advantage that the night was also quit. And just some minutes to walk, the cultural centre of Berlin Mitte can be reached - the Museumsinsel. A metro station is also just arround the corner. So I can recommend this hotel for a weekend stand.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinJud
Reviews.Content: My wife, grandson and I stayed at the Best Western Spittelmarkt Hotel for four days at the end of June, 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The front desk people were extremely pleasant and helpful in aiding us to retreive some lost Rail Europe tickets. They also helped us in selecting sites to see and places to eat. We were able to walk to many of the things we wanted to see due to the great location of this hotel. Our room was very clean and noise free. The only mild complaint I would have is the cost (9 Euros) of the breakfast. It was all or nothing. I would gladly stay here if I'm ever in Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin City Break”
Reviews.Author: psticks
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel in quiet location. The staff were very helpful, as soon as we turned up on our motorbikes they came out in the torrential rain, which had just started, to show us where we could park in a quiet secure location. They were also very helpful the next day when we had to buy a sat nav to replace one which had broken. They rang shops to see what they had in stock and the price. Free wifi in the lobby so we could email home. Only a small bar and restaraunt but if you come to Berlin you would probably want to explore and eat out. The room was very clean and presentable. Nice touch in that we took a bottle of Prosecco back to the room and the staff left two champagne flutes next to it for when we drank it. The hotel is very close to the underground station for sight seeing. Across the road is a cafe where you can sit outside for breakfast. All in all, a great stay for us and we when we go back, we will check out vacancies here first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast, Clean Rooms, and Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: glorygirl14
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The room was spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable, and it was quiet at night which is so nice when you are traveling and dog tired.The location was excellent, with a nice Spanish restaurant across the street. The breakfast was unbelievable: they had two rooms filled with an excellent variety of food and drinks. The staff was especially efficient and helpful-including having a cab for us at 5am on our departure day. What I didn't like: the information said they had laundry facilities, which they do not. We had to have a washing (we travel light) and it cost more euros than I want to admit. But we would absolutely stay here again, and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the center of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Shrubbo
Reviews.Content: I always get a bit nervous when booking a hotel with a lower price. You can never be fully sure if you're getting a great deal at a good place, or just a lower quality hotel. Luckily, this hotel exceeded my expectations. I arrived after a red-eye from New York, lugging all my bags through the Berlin buses and u-bahns, and was glad it was located right next to the u-bahn station. This makes it great for getting around town, though Berlin is compact enough as it is that you can walk to almost any major sight. Our room wasn't ready yet, which was fine as we were early, and they had a large selection of lockers downstairs to stow your bags until check-in time. Only a 1 Euro deposit for the locker, so it's essentially free. Staff were all friendly, helpful, and attentive. The room was much bigger than expected. Looking at the floorplan, we got the biggest room in the building (any room x01 it seems) which was the front corner on a high floor (6 out of 9). The beds were easy to separate and very comfortable. The bathroom has a large tub and a separate shower. The A/C was appreciated as it was the hottest day of the year yet, making an end of the day bath even more enjoyable. We didn't try the breakfast, but it looked like it offered a very wide selection. There are two bakeries just across the street, so we went there instead. There were restaurants as well, which could also come in handy. Only downside was no free wi-fi. There was free internet in the room, but it required a cable (which they provide), but wi-fi is always preferable so multiple people can use it at a time. Will definitely stay again when I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Hoteluser_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for sightseeing in central Berlin. Easy to find and to get to from the Airport. Great selection of restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel itself is fairly new with eight storeys in two blocks. The rooms are not large but adequate and well appointed. Breakfast is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice u-bahn wise”
Reviews.Author: PyynikinParoni
Reviews.Content: Very decent hotel with a great location when using u-bahn. Nearest stop is just around the corner which is the most important value for me when choosing a hotel in Berlin. Good breakfast, but expensive as always in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sljeme1
Reviews.Content: nice,clean,good location,quiet,free internet,near metro station

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nickademus64
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be of a very good standard. Having lost some luggage on our trip from London by air I must commend the efforts of the reception staff to return the suitcase to us when it finally arrived at the hotel. The breakfast was excellent and the room very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bharath203
Reviews.Content: Positives 1. Excellent location.- 2 mins walk from spittlmarket metro- 2.Room sizes are good. Clean rooms. 3.Free wired internet in the room with decent speed. 4.Courteous staff 5. Parking available but paid. Negatives 1.No refrigerator in the the room 2.Not many eat outs in walking distance to the hotel except a coffee shop just opposite. Overall, a good experience in this hotel. Was not disappointed. Had a good outing. The location is good. Its definitely worth the price. Go choice if you are on a sightseeing trip to berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive hotel in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: ALeJune
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in Berlin where I stayed at this hotel. The hotel is right around the corner from the Spittelmarkt underground, which is convienient for going to the sights in the city. It is also walking distance to Hackersmarkt and the museums on museuminsel. The hotel was extremely clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke great English. The rooms were extremely comfortable and had AC that worked very well!! The rooms had a decent size bathroom and everything was modern and updated. I would definitely recommended this hotel to anyone wanting to stay near the sights and that doesn't want to pay too much for a room. GREAT value for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location, perfect for a city-trip to Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: skycruiserNL
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a 3-day citytrip to Berlin and enjoyed our stay. In the beginning we took a while to find the hotel itself (we took the wrong exit from the U-bahn/underground), but German people on the street were kind enough to assist a bit and gave directions. Check-in was smooth and we got a room right away. Though, the hall/check-in area is a bit on the small side, and especially in the mornings it gets crowded by people checking out, joining for breakfast etc. Rooms are as new, TV available, beds are giving a good rest. The hotel is quietly located, no worry about traffic noise etc. Bathroom has a modern look and offers all you need actually. Opposite of the hotel is a typical German bakery (konditorei), so you can grab a nice fresh sandwich or pastry from there also when going out and heading to town.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravellingguy00
Reviews.Content: A good quality hotel in a great location for tourists. The room was spotlessly clean as we have come to expect in Germany. Breakfast was exceptionally good - great choice and quality. We spent three days in Berlin and with the hotel's central location we saw everything we had hoped to on foot or on a river boat trip from the nearby quay. The bus from Tegel Airport drops off in Alexanderplatz which, if you are travelling light, is within comfortable walking distance of the hotel. Plenty of places to eat nearby - especially on Leipzigerstrasse. Only minor disappointment was the tapas bar opposite - food is great but the apparent act of kindness from the waiter when a dish was brought that we hadn't ordered (big smile - "it's for you") was spoilt by its appearance on the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a clean, comfortable and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: LorraineG57
Reviews.Content: My partner, our grown up son and I have just returned from six days in Berlin and we had a wonderful time. It's a great city, full of interest, and one which we would all love to return to before too long. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Best Western Hotel am Spittelmarkt again. It represents good value-for-money, and our accommodation was perfectly adequate; comfortable, clean and convenient for getting around the city, the U Bahn station at Spittelmarkt being only a few minutes walk from the hotel. We were so busy cramming in all the things we wanted to do that we didn't have a lot of contact with the staff but, when we did, they were pleasant and helpful. We never took breakfast in the hotel, although it seemed very popular, preferring to soak up the local scene and having a coffee and a croissant in one of the near by coffee shops/take-aways. Convenient supermarket near by too, for essentials. Tea/coffee making facilities in the room would have been nice, but not a deal-breaker. The provision of lockers to store your luggage on the last day of your trip is great - a 1 euro returnable deposit is all that is required. A word of caution, though, the service seems very popular, so you need to be relatively early to be sure of a locker. All in all, a good choice if you are content with simple, modern clean and comfortable accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: ddrCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with directing the group of us to the main sights of Berlin. They made sure that we knew which direction to head in. The room was small and cozy, beds were very comfortable. There was also a safe in the room. Bathroom was a little of on the smaller side, definitely a one person bathroom! Location was on the former east side of Berlin and therefore the price was a little cheaper and it was still within walking distance to Checkpoint Charlie, Berlin Wall, and the numerous other sites. Breakfast was not included but is well worth the extra cost. Had the best variety that I've seen at a hotel in Europe. Walking back to the hotel at night was also alright. Make sure you eat in the main city center of Berlin because there was not much for food around the hotel in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachepete
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located to the East of central Berlin. Very close to the ubahn, a couple of stops from Alexanderplaz. Rooms are very clean spacious and well maintained, although this seems like a new hotel. It is in a quiet location, great for a good night sleep. We booked room only which was ideal as there is plenty on offer around the city. Although on the last morning we went to the breakfast room and there was certainly plenty of choice should you wish to included breakfast. Altogether a great value and ideal hotel for the business or tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Value, Sevice can be better”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Smit_76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well maintained, with modern rooms and facilities and free internet access. I booked “room only” and I was taking breakfast in a cafe opposite the hotel which has a wide variety of choices for good price (the breakfast in the hotel is 9 euro…). In general it is a good hotel but I find people at reception not very keen to help guest and give that little extra attention.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for money and very modern and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: robrobLondon
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and neat. Staff very very helpful and really cared about helping their guests. The free use of computers in the lobby was a great bonus. Location was very good, near underground and in walking distance to most sights, would reccommend it. If you don't want to have breakfast in the hotel-we didn't, I would reccommend walking or taking the short tube ride to Alexanderplatz and going to the 'back factory' its a cheap and great chain of German bakeries, and there is one right near Alenanderplatz station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: SomersetSpud
Reviews.Content: A very good value, clean and well-organised hotel. Breakfast very good, location unbeatable (right next to the U-Bahn) and the room was clean & comfortable and the staff helpful & English-speaking. However, if you like old characterful hotels with plush, luxurious public rooms and bars then don't come here as it is all a little more utilitarian. Free internet a bonus (in the foyer), coffee shop outside, ATM by the door, Tapas bar opposite and a cheap 'n cheerful Berlin pub (the Spittleck) around the corner. The noise; It struck me that Berlin, especially the East, is a massive building site so the noise outside (as others have reported) was to be expected and only really obtrusive from 0730 hrs onwards and then only if the window was open. So get up early (ish), get breakfast and get out to see the sights! Recommend the Welcome card and then just get stuck into using all the transport; train, bus, tram U & S bahn - all very integrated and easy to understand & use.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with hotels commitments and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: Jenny201174
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friends had a 2 night stay in this Hotel. we had a lovely time. hotel was very clean,warm and comfortable. staff at reception were very friendly. most of all i've took the time to write this review as the last night i stayed at the hotel i left a links of london bracelet and a new jumper behind in room. i let the hotel know as soon as i discovered this and within a week the friendly staff of the hotel had my items posted to me. i was over the moon to recieve them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsB_Leeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a three night break from 30th January 2011. We booked through the Best Western American website and saved £££ compared to Hotels.com or the UK website. The hotel overall cost about £40 a night, we didn't take breakfast but followed the advice of previous reviewers and used the bakery opposite for a cheap and yummy breakfast. The underground is literally around the corner from the hotel and is so easy and convenient to use you can get anywhere in Berlin. Many of the main attractions including Checkpoint Charlie, Potsdamer Platz, Alexander Platz and the Brandenburg are within walking distance. The only downside was the temperature in the rooms was very high even with the heating off and the windows open, not being fans of air con this left us a little warm but for a brand new, centrally located, clean and friendly hotel for this price was only a small negative!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: versace777
Reviews.Content: Close to metro, located in center, many sights r walking distance, rather fair price, excellent breakfast, late check-out for 30 euro, very attentive staff. the only real inconvenience was that we had to go 1 floor down, then walk through the breakfast room and then go again up to access our room which was in the second building. but assuming rates and late check-out option, so convinient for us, we were ok about that. room was a bit small and walls were a bit thin (noise heard once). but to summarise, it's perfectly ok for friends/single/or reasonably budget stay. not good for a romantic getaway, special occasions of any type or senior travellers who might require more comfort.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant new hotel just outside the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Avsecken
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great surprise. Although the surroundings are a bit empty at night and there are not many restaurants or bars around, there was nothing to worry about and it was not far from the main tourist locations. It is just 5 minutes away from the Spittermarkt subway station. If you don't mind walking 10-30 minutes, you can easily get to most of the main attractions on foot (Checkpoint Charlie, Tiergarten, Brandenburger Tor, Potsdamer Platz, Museum Island, Alexanderplatz). It looks very new, everything is modern, clean, well lit, a good bed, no complaints there. The AC, TV and internet (cable) worked perfectly. The breakfast (not included) was delightful - everything you can ask for on a non-luxury hotel, and it did not disappoint me at all, definitely worth paying. Fruit, cereal, juice, breads, cold cuts, hot dishes, yogurt, cakes, coffee, teas... be sure to enjoy that meal. There are some construction sites near the hotel, which may wake you up in the morning. Try to get a room opposite from it to avoid the noise. The bottomline - the Best Westerm Am Spittelmarkt is not right in the middle of the city, but it's just what I want in a hotel. I won't look for another option if I go back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: BNAUK
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and tidy hotel. On arriving at Spittelmarkt underground, the hotel is about 100m around the corner. Reception staff were helpfull and the room was clean and tidy however, no tea or coffee making facilities. My only faults on our trip to do with the hotel was that the breakfast was only OK, simply because when we arrived at about 9:30 most of the hot food had gone and when we asked for more, we eventually had to ask three times even though breakfast was open till 10am, before any turned up. Remember you pay extra for breakfast. And on our last day, not technically the hotels fault, but the fire alarm went off at 7:30 because of someones hot shower. Some people write reviews about construction noise at this hotel, didn't bother me. I would recommend this hotel. Berlin though is a fantastic city, well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Can Handle the pressure”
Reviews.Author: busylad83
Reviews.Content: Contiki tour group starting point, great location, newly renovated (at the time) and firendly staff. I was there in the middle of their coldest winter in 40 years and lets just say the central heating still worked even as I would walk in and out the sliding doors to have a cigarette (yes I have quit, disgusting habit). Friendly very well spoken (in English) staff and a good start to my European experience.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: jbamail
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was close to a business meeting, and most other hotels in the area were booked out. It was ok, the room was clean and the staff were very professional, but it was rather soulless - I felt like I was staying in a hospital - and the breakfast area had all the charm of a cheap cafeteria.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame the bar area is also the reception area”
Reviews.Author: janieChania
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near the underground and makes it easy to travel around. The rooms are not too big but clean and the beds are just soooooo comfy. Lovely shower rooms look like they have just been renewed. The only downfall is the bar, or the other end of the reception area with four stools, they could easily convert part of one of the breakfast rooms for evening use. All the staff are very friendly and helpfull and all speak good English. Also the Berlin underground is very safe clean and frequent. Impressed with the whole city. Try the Spitteleck to eat, its just round the corner, ate there every night after we found it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: The_Travel_G0ddess
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and found the location very convenient for the underground and getting around Berlin. It is only about a 15-20 minute walk to both Potsdamer Platz and Alexander Platz and within walking distance to numerous restaurants. There is construction around the hotel but our room didn't face the street, we heard no noise so it was not a problem. We did use the bakery across the street for baked goods for breakfast, it was very good. The room did not have coffee/tea making facilities when we arrived but we were provided with them upon request at the front desk. We felt this hotel was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: lunasbear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western for a couple nights during a Berlin visit. The Hotel located at Spittelmarkt with the Subway right around the corner to Line 2 which connects the Alexanderplatz to potsdamer platz easily, but even when you're walking it's only 15-20 minutes to get to either. Unfortunately there is construction right across the Hotel which probably will be there for a while longer. The rooms are nice. Hardly any decor, but clean. The staff didn't impress me as much. Check in is not possible before 2 p.m. they are not really able to store luggage if you arrive early and you unfortunately nobody will greet you when walking into the Lobby or restaurant first un like other hotels I've stayed at. They offer breakfast for 9 Euros and have a small computer in the restaurant for surfing the internet, but very open to others. They have a small amount of parking spaces and there is a bakery right across the street for a cheap breakfast. All in all. It's Berlin and you won't be spending much time in the hotel so for beeing close to everything by Subway it's a good place to stay considering you could be spending double for less in a fancy neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly and within easy reach of the sights of Mitte.”
Reviews.Author: JJfromtheEast
Reviews.Content: Just a straigtforwardly clean and comfortable stay in the heart of Berlin. Excellent breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Will be really good in 12 months”
Reviews.Author: Millersenvacance
Reviews.Content: The room was huge - easily fitting two teenage boys and me. Flat screen TV, fabulous bathroom - modern and clean as a whistle. BUT the construction zone that surrounds it is a pain at the moment. Our room, with insulating windows was at the front of the hotel and at 0630 the trucks started arriving and then it was on for the rest of the day. Subway is close by, and around the corner 9as directed by the reception staff) is a super cheap genuine german pub style restaurant that we all enjoyed enormously. In 12 months, when all the noise is gone, it will be far more appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for such price .”
Reviews.Author: Azjolek
Reviews.Content: Price - very good(150euro/double room,2nights), perfect location-in the center ,next to metro station,2metro stations from Alexanderplatz, breakfast - correct (clean tables, fresh food) , rooms - very good (clean rooms and bathrooms,comfortable beds), staff - very nice :) I have nothing bad to say about this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean room amzing breakfast!!!!”
Reviews.Author: etoui
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay there, large room, very clean and new, subway connection just around the corner and the breakfast amazing! and you can park your bicycle outside your hotel and feel safe!

Reviews.Title: “New with a good location”
Reviews.Author: kmilitzer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a business trip to the IFA (consumer electronics fair) for one night. The hotel is quite new, the rooms are spacious, clean and quiet. The location of the hotel, which is in the eastern part of Berlin is great, there's a subway stop a mere 100m away that takes you directly to Potsdammer Platz where you can eat, club or see movies at the Sony Center. Also the government quarter with the Reichstag and Brandenburger Tor can be reached in a few minutes. The staff was really nice and helpfull, they provided me with a city map, as well as an ironing board when I needed one. They have free Internet, thought it's wired only and no WiFi but fast and reliable. The bathroom was very clean and had a window, which is a plus I think. The breakfast selection was good, also it took me some time to figure that coffee is not served, but you have to get yourself a thermos next to the orange juice. The breakfast area was quite crowded and noisy, but that may have been because of vacation time and the IFA.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, ask for a room AWAY from construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Skooter22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, located very close to a the Berlin metro system, and the staff was very helpful. Nice beds, though I had two twin beds pushed together and I wished I'd requested a double bed, though I don't know if they have them. Breakfast is very, very good and worth the 9 euros unless you have a better idea of where to go. There was a LOT of construction and I changed rooms after the first night and didn't have a problem after that. Towel warmers were great for hand-washed clothes drying. Free internet access, though not wireless. I paid a little under 50 euros a night. Women travelers: it's a safe neighborhood but deserted at night so I felt more comfortable taking a taxi home at the end of the evening. No black-out curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be deceived by photos of hotel rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett5555
Reviews.Content: The room was very small - all you could do was walk around the bed. The shower cabin was tiny. We booked a double room and the bed was small and uncomfortable, the pillows were like a piece of soft rag stuffed into a pillow-case. Our room was situated on the first floor where the view was depressing -no greenery around the hotel, except for construction works. The hotel's reception desk is very unattractive and there is no lobby. We were deceived by the nice photos of the rooms on the Hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Construction All Around - July 2010”
Reviews.Author: LC888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at a quiet area except for the construction activities during our stay. Luckily, I have my putty ear plugs which blocked out all the early morning noises. The beds need new mattresses. Bathroom is large and very comfortable after just having stayed at a hotel in Amsterdam with a bathroom about 1/10th the size of the bathroom at Best Western Hotel am Spittelmarkt. Location is not ideal for sight seeing as one has to take the U-Bahn to reach to most sights, and that too, you need to change trains. The cleaner enters your room every morning at 10AM without knocking or at least saying "Room Service!" first before simply unlocking the door and walks freely into your room. So, don't forget to put the "Do Not Disturb" sign as we kept forgetting to do this. Taxi from TXL to hotel is approximately EUR21-23 which is very reasonable if there are three or more of you as it takes half the time compared to the bus services to Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: juer15
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Best Western Hotel am Spittelmarkt and I only have great things to say. The rooms are a fine size for 2, it has a very nice modern decour and it's cleaned everyday. The only thing missing is a minibar. Can't say much about the breakfast, we thought it was a bit expensive and there is a very good bakery just on the other side where you can eat from just over 2 euros. I was a little bit worried about all the comments about the construction going on, so I asked in advance to be put in a quiet room and that's what we got, so it was no problem at all. The location is very good. The U-bahn station just 200-300 m from the hotel, but if you're up for it you can walk basically everywhere around Mitte. Alexanderplatz is actually really close and Potzdamer Platz ain't that far away either. We tried the Tapas restaurant next to the bakery on our last night and were pleasently suprised it was really good, but either come early or make reservations, it's crowded around dinner time. If you want a cheap and really good place to eat, you can walk about 500 m from the hotel on to Leipzieger strasse, on the right hand is a really good Vietnamese restaurant, it's difficult to see, but just opposite from the beer garten, and by the way, don't eat at the beer garten, it's pretty much full of old people by dinner time, but don't be fooled, it's horrible and overprized! But overall we had a really nice stay, and I can definitely recommend this if you want a nice, clean hotel at a good location and don't care too much about a lot of extra facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakast. Clean rooms. Reasonable location in a large city”
Reviews.Author: thewaterboy
Reviews.Content: It's a rather large hotel set just south of the museum island district. There isn't much happening around the area as it appears to be just off a main road with mainly offices about. However, it wasn't far t walk down towards Checkpoint Charlie - Zimmerstrasse - Fredrichstrasse, as well as Potsdamer Platz. The A/C didn't seem to be blowing cold air, only warm air which was a minor annoyance as it was still reasonably cold in March. The hotel would have rectified that if we decided to complain but that was alright. The breakfast lounge is large, with different seating themes to compliment a Parisien cafe, Thai noodle bar, Berliner pub etc. There were quite a few tourists so its prob going to be a bit crowded in the busy summer months. The area is a bit deserted and there are some vacant plots and ugly apartment blocks further south of it. That said, not all of Berlin is pretty which goes with its turbulent past; and suffice to say that we never felt unsafe in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Top Value, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: FlashSydney
Reviews.Content: A great choice for the regular visitor to Berlin, but could feel a little isolated to first-timers. Some of the reviews reflect this fact with comments such as it is out of the way. On the contrary, it is a short walk to many major attractions - the Nicolaiviertel, Gendarmenmarkt, Checkpoint Charlie, the Brandenburg Gate etc - it's simply a matter of getting your bearings. The U-bahn is round the corner and it's a fast ride to the Ku'damm, Potsdamer Platz and only 2 euros 80 to Potsdam - changing at Potsdamer. We received a huge room - with a separate room for child or third guest - for only 70 euros a night. It was spotless, great linen and the water pressure was the best throughout our European trip. The breakfast buffet was superb for 9 euros per person and there's a computer for free internet use. The front office staff are extremely helpful, cheerful and knowledgable and the breakfast staff are welcoming and friendly, too. Every night we walked to the Nicolaiviertel for dinner. It's the oldest part of Berlin and full of atmospheric shops and Old Berliner restaurants. It's only a five minute walk to the Lowenbrau kKller and all the other restaurants of Gendarmenmarkt, too. Yes, it's a Best Western so you won't get heritage and tradition but there's plenty of that in Berlin. This hotel would have been great value for a much higher room rate, but the fantasic deal in summer was a clincher for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal!”
Reviews.Author: juma_22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new in Berlin! the rooms are small but very modern! It has free internet (LAN) and the location is very good. Berlin´s main attractions are near to the hotel. The breakfast is better than usual for a Best western. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel since it was very clean, modern and good located!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mosari
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in this place in Berlin and it was a great experience. The fron office staff are really helpful. What impressed us the most was how clean and tidy the room was. We could hardly believe that it was a three star hotel. The location is also very nice since it is just a few stops away from the attractions. If you are planning to visit Berlin for sight seeing I think this place could be one of your best choices. We did not get breakfast so I can not comment on that. The price was also very reasonable for that part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: rebe87
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at this hotel. Excellent location, close to a metro station or 20 min walk into the city centre. Clean, new hotel with large spacious room. I would recomend this hotel. If you don't want breakfast at the hotel there is an excellent bakery across the street which is very cheap and for lunch, near the bakery, there is also a great spanish restaurant "tapas y mas"

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: soultraveller76
Reviews.Content: Good new and modern hotel, not a luxury establishment but was not expecting that. Basic equipment (at least for our room) but spotlessly clean. Beds are comfortable, even the rollaway bed we required- albeit little more than a camp bed - was surprisingly confortable. Liked the breakfast room(s), each decorated in a different style. Buffet is good and decently varied, although had the breakfast not been included in our rate we would probably not have paid the 9Euros it costs. The area is not particularly interesting but a short metro ride to practically everywhere, and we never felt unsafe walking about, even at late hours. The staff is overall ok but could use a little more friendliness (sometimes they looked like they would rather be elsewhere). I find that the internet point for the Guests in the basment (right next to the breakfast rooms) is not ideally placed. There is also free WiFi access but only works in the basement area - couldn't even get it to work on the ground floor/lobby area. All things considered, we find it can be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean and cozy”
Reviews.Author: ephemere
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes walk to Potsdamer Platz, a Spanish restaurant and a bakery front the hotel building. As the construction of other buildings take place next to the hotel the construction noise could disturb you from 8 o'clock in the morning. They don't have Wireless internet access but they provide you with LAN cable and internet access speed is quite high. You can buy a bottle of water for 3 Euro which is really cheap compared to other 3-star hotels. The room is tiny but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Newlandsfieldman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a 15 minute walk in one direction to Alexanderplatz / Berliner Dom/ Fernsehturm and about 10 minutes in the other direction to Friedrichstrasse/ Gendarmenmarkt/ Checkpoint Charlie. It's also just around the corner from Spittelmarkt U-Bahn station on Line U2. (This line links many of the main sites but is not just as convenient for getting to and from Schoenfeld airport - about an hour's journey by U and S Bahn if all goes to plan). Contrary to some other reports my wife and I found the desk staff helpful when asking for any information although I suppose it depends who you speak to. The cleaner did knock the door the back of nine, which is maybe a bit early, but was very apologetic and always did a good job when she returned after we went out. The room itself was great. Exceptionally clean and a decent size. Bed and pillows were comfortable. The bathroom wasn't particularly big but I wouldn't say smaller than average and didn't cause any problems. It had the best shower I think I've ever used. TV wise another English speaking channel than CNN would have been good but you don't go on holiday to watch TV. There is some construction work ongoing right across the road from the front of the hotel. Our room was at the back of the rear of the two connected buildings that make up the hotel so we did not have any noise problems whatsoever. That said, it may have been more noticeable in the front rooms. Can't comment on the food as we didn't eat there. For breakfast it was much cheaper to use the very good bakery situated right across the road from the hotel (not open on Sunday). Unfortunately there were no other shops/restaurants in the immediate vicinity other than a tapas bar but it didn't cause us a problem as once we had our breakfast we didn't return to the hotel till late in the evening. Closest place to buy snacks is probably the Lidl Supermarket about 5 minutes walk along Leipziger Strasse. Overall, the hotel is really good value for money. It's conveniently situated, modern, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Clacg Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Berlin for a week-end and that hotel has been the perfect place for recovering after long walks and nights! Friendly staff, cozy and clean room, close to the U-bahn station and to the center. We had really great time!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, location for dinner....er, no.”
Reviews.Author: jamesangela
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last summer for my first 2 weeks into my new job in Berlin. Clean and modern rooms, nice breakfast and helpful staff. The only negative is the location. Yes, it is right by an U-Bahn but when it comes to popping out for food ( no restaurant at the hotel except for breakfast) it's really bad. If you get the munchies for some chips or a bottle of juice it really is no-mans land ( probably pretty close to the real thing 25 years ago!) There is also free wi-fi, but the in-house computer is a bit rubbish ( located in the restaurant so if you're checking your emails in the morning, everyone watches you!!) Saying that though, decent rooms, HUGE pillows, clean and fresh. Take snacks, you have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: SSAN21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights as part of an organised tour and it was a lot better than I expected. Good: The rooms are clean and new, with really nice bathrooms and comfy beds, the metro is very close, free internet, the buffet breakfast is AMAZING and in 3 days I didn't get to try all they had on offer Bad: Rececption staff were a bit rude and not too helpful, the hotel has no character I would definetly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “If you're in Berlin only to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: SuntripperOslo
Reviews.Content: Good about this hotel: Fairly good price. The rooms are modern and clean. The beds are really comfortable. The hotel is quiet, only little noise from the corridor. The hotel is located central in Berlin. Subway is by far the best way of getting around in Berlin, and the nearest subway station is only a few hundred meters away. Not so good about this hotel: The rooms are tiny and everything else than colorful. The nearest surroundings are Berlin-grey buildings, making the view or a walk in the neighborhood not very enchanting. You get the feeling that the hotel is much further away from the center than it really is. Rooms have no minibar, no pay-tv, and the hotel have no bar. The most negative with the hotel is the staff; the cleaning ladies came into my room not less than three times even if I hang the Do-not-disturb sign on the door; the receptionists were not friendly, helpful or interested in providing any service. I think it is important that the staff in a hotel actually likes working in the hotel business… My conclusion is: It’s a great hotel to stay at if you are in Berlin on your own, if you are looking for a cheap and central place to stay, if you’re not a demanding customer, or if you are in Berlin for business trip. I would not recommend the hotel if you want a bit of luxury, if you want to live close to bars, nightclubs or restaurants, or if you’re staying in Berlin for a romantic weekend. In the last case I would much rather stay at Hotel Berlin Meliã.

Reviews.Title: “Wanna spend a romantic weekend, don't go here!”
Reviews.Author: AJ-NL
Reviews.Content: We decided to go for this hotel based on its location and pictures, and the price was reasonable (but for New Year's Eve everything is expensive...) Pro: good beds, great shower (yet very small cabin), very clean, reasonable location, good breakfast, TV with MTV, free Internet (via cable) Con: only seperate beds (with seperate bedcovers!), very small rooms and tiny bathroom, not very helpfull staff at reception (too young and uninterested), no minibar The room has been photographed in a smart way, cause on the pictures it seems spacious whereas it's very small. The beds were very comfortable, but when you want to have a romantic weekend it's no fun having 2 seperate beds with also seperate bedcovers. Reception stated they had only 1 type of room..... so it's a great business hotel :-) The breakfast is extensive and if you don't book it ahead you can use it anyway as they don't check roomnumbers... Most annoying to us was the reception staff who gave only half information, forgot to book a taxi when asked to do so, etc. Conclusion: uncomplicated hotel for business: yes; but don't spend your city-weekend break here!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: BoltonianLou16
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my mum to this hotel at the start of Dec. Stayed four nights and were in a room at the back of the hotel away from the construction work on the front. This was fine over the weekend - no work! But did start quite early on the Monday and Tuesday morning - we could hear it despite being off the road. Wont last forever though and not to put people off!! Good hotel, great location. Does feel quite isolated walking down the street late on at night but felt safe enough. Hotel was clean, staff very helpful and beds comfy - shower also powerful!! Loads to see in Berlin, we stayed four days and this was more than enough to see everything. 3 days would be the optimum!! Enjoy your stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay here!”
Reviews.Author: canveyjanice
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel on Dec 8 which was my husband's birthday - two wine glasses and a bottle of Cava were waiting for us to celebrate his 60th! We had a big room, which was spotless and well furnished. Hotel is near a uban station, but you can walk to most of the landmarks, checkpoint charlie & brandenberg gate. Do take the tour bus - 20 euros each but well worth it - Berlin is a big city, plenty to keep you occupied, we were only there for two days could have done with an extra day. The Christmas markets were awesome - everywhere was so festive, just like Christmas used to be in England... Please visit the Tapas bar opposite the hotel, wonderful food, service & atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: velogiant
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find via Ubahn after arriving via plane. The spanish resturant across the street was such fun. This hotel has got buffet breakfast happening on an industrial scale. Some of the reception staff were very blunt but still did their job. The room service guy was more personable. The hotel is in a quiet location and resturants are located about 10mins walk away. Our room was spacious and the bathroom had lots of room.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect solution in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Venusia77
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice, in a wonderful location, two steps from the u-ban station... and breakfast is greta!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, brand new room and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: combo_pier
Reviews.Content: This place was being offered on expedia.co.uk for a special rate. The staff are extremely helpful, they helped me print important paperwork and fax it off too - all for free. We loved how it was close to all the attractions (15 minutes walk to Berlin Cathedral) and only a skip away from the U-bahn Spittelmarkt. There was also free internet in our rate which we found useful as it helped us plan spots to hit up for dinner. The room is clean and brand new, comfy bed and pillows with aircon.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern, peaceful”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaJaneCambridge
Reviews.Content: We only had one night in Berlin and booked this without knowing much about it in advance. We were pleasantly impressed all round. The staff were helpful, the standards high, there was parking though we were only minutes from Alexanderplatz. The room was very comfortable and above all quiet and restful, though we were in a central location, and the breakfast fine. What more could we ask? It was a lovely experience and we would highly recommend it. Jane Brander

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: scorpios2001
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is central, clean and near to the metro station. You can also walk to many seightseeings. There are two negative things at the Hotel. There is no fridge in the room and the parking costs 10 Euros each day. But you can park across the street(Zone 2) for 5 Euros. Ask at the reception .They didn' t tell us at first.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: seamonkey03
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty small and the bed was not very comfortable, but okay for the price. Location was out-of-the-way, but very close to a metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for our visit to Berlin”
Reviews.Author: terracotta_army
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2009. Very new hotel in a quiet area of Berlin. Metro station was just a few minutes walk away so could get to other parts of Berlin easily via public transport. However, Nicolaikirche area was only about 10-15 mins walk away with some very good restaurants there. Then only only 5-10 mins walk to the TV tower and Alexanderplatz and Rathaus. Potsdamer Platz in opposite direction was a bit further - about 30 mins leisurely walk. The hotel was also very close to the Berlin Wall trail which we followed one day to Checkpoint Charlie and another day the opposite way towards the East Gallery section of the wall. The hotel staff were very helpful and gave us a free map of Berlin to use when we asked for it. They also provide complimentary tea/coffee trays but you do have to ask them for it at reception - very useful! Room was not massive but had enough room for us. Everything was clean and modern since it was a new hotel. We also managed to book it for a reasonable price so we were happy. Would probably use it again if we ever returned.

Reviews.Title: “Good but colourless hotel. Correct, nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: esser
Reviews.Content: New large hotel on a practical location. Good bed. Room without a view. The staff is rather like the building: cold but efficient. Not a single word too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Adda314
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel in March for 3 nights. We came to the hotel and found out that our reservation was not there (my mistake). The staff graciously accommodated us and actually ended up paying less than I would have paid if I had reserved it in advance. The room was on the first floor, with no view (did not matter to us) but very clean. It is a new hotel (a little construction still going on outside, nothing disturbing though) so obviously everything is in very good condition. I am working in a hospitality school so I was paying much attention to the service. It was very good, especially the Swedish guy at the Front Desk who was very helpful. Other girls at the front office did not seem so knowledgeable but were nice. The location was perfect for us, cosy and intimate. A short walk from the subway, one of the main lines, and as one finds out in Berlin, that is enough. The public transportation is great, easy to use, and on time all the time. Breakfast was really good, with a large variety of food and the breakfast area is very nice and stylish. It was the fist Best Western I stayed in, and was very content with everything. I would definitely go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Walk from Underground”
Reviews.Author: Stevanne
Reviews.Content: We chose this type of hotel having never travelled into Europe we wanted a well known chain we could rely on. They didn't disappoint. Very helpful staff and seemed much more friendly than others when we were out and about in Berlin. We have stayed in many hotels and BB's since and this hotel was a rare find with tea and coffee making in the room. A great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tripadv12345
